summary:
■	Governance - Public Administration Reform
Public administration systems and structures, strategy and policy development, long- and medium-term planning, organisational review of public institutions, public finance management, administrative reform, civil service reform, inter-institutional co-operation, cross-cutting issues, de-centralisation, regional, municipal and local government development, civil service training, financial aid administration, staffing policy.

■	Institutional Development - Capacity Strengthening - Human Resources Management
Organisational review, training needs assessment, training strategy development, functional reviews, reform and change management, senior level strategic advisory services, change management, inter-institutional communication, performance improvement, monitoring and assessment, evaluation (programme, project, sector and thematic), facilitating workshops and training sessions, management development of complex organisations, on-the-job coaching, reporting and communication framework development.

■	Donor Coordination
Grant scheme program coordination, aid effectiveness, donor collaboration, inter- and intra-institutional coordination, trust fund management, multi-annual programming, project identification and formulation.

■	EU Integration Process
Extensive, multi-annual experience on EU pre-accession programming and post accession support. IPA project and programme management, project cycle management (PCM), approximation of national legislation with the “Acquis Communautaire”, collaboration with National Assembly’s, donor co-ordination, programme and project evaluation and assessment, operational management of programmes and projects in line with EU standard  procedures, general programme advisory services, preparation of project documents including project terms of references, financing proposals and budgetary developments.

■	Professional Managerial Experience
       •  Team leader of at least 16 complex donor funded institution building projects and manager of large teams of long-term and short-term experts, both local and international.
       •  Active in EU funded projects as team-leader and/or key expert since 1993 (19 years).
       •  Multi-annual experience in both technical and financial management of complex support programmes.

profile_positions.description:
The project focuses on strengthening Cicil Society Organizations (CSOs) through a grant scheme on the island of Sint Maarten in the context of the recovery and reconstruction efforts after hurricane Irma in 2017. The project is financed under the World Bank trust fund. Main tasks were:

- prepare and finalize four safeguard instruments under the WB Environmental and Social Framework mechanism: Stakeholder Engagement Plan (SEP), Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF), Labour Management Procedures (LMP) and Environmental and Social Commitment Plan (ESCP).
- prepare and finalize a project grants and a project operational manual.
profile_positions.title: “Civil Society Partnership Facility for Resilience Project (CSPFRP)” - short-term expert

profile_positions.description:
The Ethiopia Social Accountability Program (ESAP2) was implemented by the Government of Ethiopia at regional, district (woreda) and local (kebele) level. Financed through a World Bank managed multi-donor trust fund, ESAP2 was guided and supervised by VNG International which acted as Managing Agency in charge for the day-to-day operations and coordination of the program.

The overall objective of the ESAP2 was to strengthen the capacity of both citizen groups and governmental authorities at decentralised level in order to enhance the quality of basic public services delivered to citizens.

As ESAP Project Team Leader, based in Addis Ababa for the period July 2013 until June 2019, the following were the main duties and responsibilities:
• to ensure that the Management Agency Project Office in Addis Ababa implemented the ESAP2 program in line with the WB rules and procedures and the project ToR.
• to provide managerial and technical direction for the complex array of tasks of the ESAP2 program.
• to ensure that all project staff employees were supported adequately and able to carry out their respective roles efficiently. 
• being responsible for the overall delivery of the ESAP2 outputs and ensuring that quality standards were adhered to in all aspects of delivery, including reporting.
